result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desirae B. Garcia

records.addlTxt:
10:25 AM Defendant Desirae B. Garcia in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Desirae B. Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is waiting for an offer on the misdemeanor matter.
State will route both files to ADA Boese for a possible global offer.
Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:15 AM Defendant Desirae B. Garcia in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Desirae B. Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant Desirae B. Garcia in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim hearing time limits.
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:00 PM Defendant Desirae B. Garcia in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states she did not qualify for Public Defender Representation but has recently lost her job.  The defendant is asking for an adjournment to allow her additional time to retain private counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:14 PM Defendant Desirae B. Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
